Medical Physics Resident and Postdoctoral Fellow

In radiation oncology, a prescription for therapeutic radiation must be co-signed by both a board certified physician and a board-certified physicist. In 2009, there was a transition in national policy which required that, in order to become board-certified, a radiation oncology medical physicist would need to first complete an accredited residency program. Johns Hopkins recruited me to be the first resident in their medical physics program in a dual role where I also did research as a postdoctoral fellow. Based on my interest in research leadership, and because so much of the nation's research investment is clinically-focused, I chose this opportunity as an important supplement to my existing research and policy background. While at Hopkins, I gained broad first-hand experience with clinical work, including participation in a range of clinical and computational research projects.

Experience: Small engineering consulting firm with expertise in the design and analysis of aeronautical communication, navigation and surveillance radios.  Specialist in interference analysis, RTCA/ICAO document preparation and approval.

Bendix became AlliedSignal became Honeywell.  I stayed put, progressing through the engineering ranks to Senior Fellow.  In the intervening 33 years, I gained extensive experience in quantitative radio, navigation, and communications engineering disciplines, including RF link budgets and analysis, interference analysis, data modulation, encoding, error estimation, statistical detection and estimation, etc.  Additional experience in a wide variety of air traffic control ground and avionics applications, design of scanning phased array antennas and associated electronics and monitoring, integrity monitoring of navigation systems, analog and digital receiver system design, real-time digital signal processing, system level and signal processing software design.  I have been recognized by external sources (e.g. FAA, NASA, Boeing, Inmarsat, Iridium, Eurocontrol) as an expert on interference matters regarding safety-critical CNS radio links.  I'm the recipient of multiple patents and technical awards for innovative application of digital signal processing techniques to antenna, monitoring, and control designs. Published papers in areas of navigation, signal processing, GPS, approach and landing systems, applications of coding and communications theory.
